subject: Creativity
title: The Video Game Industry: Bigger Than Movies and Music Combined
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Video Game Industry: Bigger Than Movies and Music Combined usable.

hook.text: The gaming industry earns $184 billion annually. That's more than movies ($100B) and music ($26B) combined.

buildup.text: A AAA game costs $200-300 million to develop and takes 3-5 years.

discovery.text: Games combine every creative discipline: visual art, music, storytelling, architecture, animation, voice acting, UX.

twist.text: The biggest revenue isn't from AAA games. It's from free mobile games using microtransactions. Candy Crush earns $1.

climax.text: Game engines (Unreal, Unity) now power film production, architecture visualization, and military training.

punchline.text: Games aren't just an entertainment industry.

quiz.question: How does the gaming industry's revenue compare to movies and music?
options: It's larger than movies and music combined
